snippet: The apparent online recruitment of four Indian Muslims to join the fight in Iraq has shocked their home country, which had believed that it was immune from such defections.
abstract: Disappearance of four young Muslim men from Kalyan, India, who said they were going off to fight to defend Islam, shakes country with unsettling possibility that Indian Muslims could be vulnerable for recruitment; investigators have tracked young men to Mosul, Iraq, saying they were recruited over Internet by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and MANSI CHOKSI

lead_paragraph: The apparent online recruitment of four Indian Muslims to join the fight in Iraq has shocked their home country, which had believed that it was immune from such defections.

headline.main: 4 Young Men Head for Iraq, Citing Fight for Islam, and India Wonders if More Will Follow
headline.print_headline: India Shaken by Case of Muslim Men Missing in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
